verses.kjv: In my distress I cried unto the LORD, and he heard me.
verses.ct: When I was in trouble, I called out to the LORD, and he answered me.

verses.kjv: Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips, and from a deceitful tongue.
verses.ct: Rescue my soul, LORD, from those who lie and from tongues that deceive.

verses.kjv: What shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee, thou false tongue?
verses.ct: What punishment will come to you, you deceitful tongue? What will be done to you?

verses.kjv: Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.
verses.ct: A warrior's sharpened arrows and burning coals of broom wood â€” that's what awaits you.

verses.kjv: Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!
verses.ct: How miserable I am, living as a foreigner in Meshech, making my home among the camps of Kedar!

verses.kjv: My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.
verses.ct: My soul has lived far too long among people who despise peace.

verses.kjv: I am for peace: but when I speak, they are for war.
verses.ct: I want peace, but whenever I open my mouth, they push for war.
